definitions.text: a gully that is shallower than a ravine
an entertainer who attracts large audiences
examples: he was the biggest drawing card they had

definitions.text: the finish of a contest in which the score is tied and the winner is undecided
examples: the game ended in a draw
their record was 3 wins, 6 losses and a tie

definitions.text: anything (straws or pebbles etc.) taken or chosen at random
examples: the luck of the draw
they drew lots for it

definitions.text: a playing card or cards dealt or taken from the pack
examples: he got a pair of kings in the draw

definitions.text: a golf shot that curves to the left for a right-handed golfer
examples: he took lessons to cure his hooking

definitions.text: (American football) the quarterback moves back as if to pass and then hands the ball to the fullback who is running toward the line of scrimmage
poker in which a player can discard cards and receive substitutes from the dealer
examples: he played only draw and stud

definitions.text: the act of drawing or hauling something
examples: the haul up the hill went very slowly

definitions.text: cause to move by pulling
examples: draw a wagon
pull a sled

definitions.text: get or derive
examples: He drew great benefits from his membership in the association

definitions.text: make a mark or lines on a surface
examples: draw a line
trace the outline of a figure in the sand

definitions.text: make, formulate, or derive in the mind
examples: I draw a line here
draw a conclusion
draw parallels
make an estimate
What do you make of his remarks?

definitions.text: bring, take, or pull out of a container or from under a cover
examples: draw a weapon
pull out a gun
The mugger pulled a knife on his victim

definitions.text: represent by making a drawing of, as with a pencil, chalk, etc. on a surface
examples: She drew an elephant
Draw me a horse

definitions.text: take liquid out of a container or well
examples: She drew water from the barrel

definitions.text: give a description of
examples: He drew an elaborate plan of attack

definitions.text: select or take in from a given group or region
examples: The participants in the experiment were drawn from a representative population

definitions.text: elicit responses, such as objections, criticism, applause, etc.
examples: The President's comments drew sharp criticism from the Republicans
The comedian drew a lot of laughter

definitions.text: suck in or take (air)
examples: draw a deep breath
draw on a cigarette

definitions.text: move or go steadily or gradually
examples: The ship drew near the shore

definitions.text: remove (a commodity) from (a supply source)
examples: She drew $2,000 from the account
The doctors drew medical supplies from the hospital's emergency bank

definitions.text: choose at random
examples: draw a card
cast lots

definitions.text: earn or achieve a base by being walked by the pitcher
examples: He drew a base on balls

definitions.text: bring or lead someone to a certain action or condition
examples: She was drawn to despair
The President refused to be drawn into delivering an ultimatum
The session was drawn to a close

definitions.text: cause to flow
examples: The nurse drew blood

definitions.text: write a legal document or paper
examples: The deed was drawn in the lawyer's office

definitions.text: engage in drawing
examples: He spent the day drawing in the garden

definitions.text: move or pull so as to cover or uncover something
examples: draw the shades
draw the curtains

definitions.text: allow a draft
examples: This chimney draws very well

definitions.text: require a specified depth for floating
examples: This boat draws 70 inches

definitions.text: pull (a person) apart with four horses tied to his extremities, so as to execute him
examples: in the old days, people were drawn and quartered for certain crimes

definitions.text: cause to move in a certain direction by exerting a force upon, either physically or in an abstract sense
examples: A declining dollar pulled down the export figures for the last quarter

definitions.text: take in, also metaphorically
examples: The sponge absorbs water well
She drew strength from the minister's words

definitions.text: direct toward itself or oneself by means of some psychological power or physical attributes
examples: Her good looks attract the stares of many men
The ad pulled in many potential customers
This pianist pulls huge crowds
The store owner was happy that the ad drew in many new customers

definitions.text: thread on or as if on a string
examples: string pearls on a string
the child drew glass beads on a string
thread dried cranberries

definitions.text: stretch back a bowstring (on an archer's bow)
examples: The archers were drawing their bows

definitions.text: pass over, across, or through
examples: He ran his eyes over her body
She ran her fingers along the carved figurine
He drew her hair through his fingers

definitions.text: finish a game with an equal number of points, goals, etc.
examples: The teams drew a tie

definitions.text: contract
examples: The material drew after it was washed in hot water

definitions.text: reduce the diameter of (a wire or metal rod) by pulling it through a die
examples: draw wire

definitions.text: steep; pass through a strainer
examples: draw pulp from the fruit

definitions.text: remove the entrails of
examples: draw a chicken

definitions.text: flatten, stretch, or mold metal or glass, by rolling or by pulling it through a die or by stretching
examples: draw steel

definitions.text: cause to localize at one point
examples: Draw blood and pus
